clues.text: In 2001 an aircraft carrier named for this former president was christened by his wife Nancy

When a cobra feels threatened, ribs spread to create this feature (also an area shared by neighbors)
Jo'burg is a nickname for this city founded in the 1880s
You'll find this Egyptian city at the southern entrance to the canal of the same name
The capital of the Seychelles has this "queenly" name, like the capital of British Columbia
As luck would have it, the 1942 film named for this city opened 3 weeks after the Allies landed there
Update your address book--Tanzania's capital is moving from this city to Dodoma
It's also called dusk & Rod Serling gave it a "zone"
In the 1970s the FCC limited TV stations' network programming during this rhyming period
We use this word for a schedule of train arrivals & departures; in England it's also a schedule of classes
In geologic time, eons are divided into these, which are in turn divided into periods
The one developed by the Society of Motion Picture & Television Engineers shows hours, minutes, seconds & frames
In cases of meningitis, Kernig's sign is hamstring pain when trying to extend this joint
Don't worry if the doc says you have an aortic sinus of Valsalva; it's a normal part of this organ
If your doctor says your condition is idiopathic or cryptogenic, he's telling you this about its cause

A patient labeled NPO, "non per os", cannot be nourished this way
Types of these you'll find in the forest include the red-eyed vireo & the scarlet tanager
Careful!  These eucalyptus eaters in the forests of New South Wales can rip you to pieces if disturbed

As opposed to evergreen, it's the term for trees in temperate forests that lose their leaves each year
You'll find this covering layer in a rainforest between the understory & the emergent layer

rounds.text: The first major use of simultaneous translation, before adoption by the U.N., was in this European city in 1945 & 1946
